group_1.narration: After the Wavering Deity was set free, @time in the village passed like a blur.
Since we had to tell everyone @the history of the Tokimes and Mikoshibas...
As well as search Mikoshiba's home @and investigate everything that went on in the background.

group_1.textLeft: Is your family fine, Sunao?

group_1.textRight: Yes, we're all completely safe.
Dad and Mom apologized to me even more than they did before...

group_1.textLeft: I'm so glad they were safe.
Now you've broken away from Mikoshiba's curse, @and you're free as a bird!

group_1.textRight: Yes.

group_1.textLeft: But you're gonna stay together with us from now on too, right?

group_1.textRight: Of course. Why wouldn't I?

group_1.textLeft: Ah—, I'm tired, @I'm tired...

group_1.textRight: It feels like things have finally settled down a notch, though.

group_1.textLeft: Honestly, everyone here is so divorced from modern society.
Without you, Ms. Hiroe, we wouldn't have @understood a thing.

group_1.textRight: Welcome back, Mom.

group_1.textLeft: Well done out there.

group_1.textRight: As far as the current case with Mikoshiba @is concerned, everything finally fell into place.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:102601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!
How'd it go?!

group_1.textRight: I'll let Ms. Hiroe do the talking.
Huh? Ah, well, okay...

group_1.narration: The root of the incident does indeed @seem to lie in the village's traditions, @but it seems that the direct trigger was @how Mikoshiba had fallen into heavy debt.
Apparently, after a huge investment failed, @she was in dire need of a source of money, @and hurriedly took advantage of the Diviners in response.

group_1.textRight: Of course, whatever her reasons were, taking advantage of people's children...
I don't think I'll ever forgive her as long as I live...

group_1.textLeft: Mom...

group_1.textRight: I'd rather not say this in front of my daughter, @but this must be what it feels like to curse someone @for generations.
Definitely...

group_1.textLeft: Aren't you her family's most recent generation, technically?

group_1.textRight: ...Come on, don't nitpick.

group_1.textLeft: Then, the reason she went to the trouble of @contacting me and Charu outside...

group_1.textRight: Sunao becoming a Diviner would've been a surprise @to Mikoshiba.
So she turned to us, which led to a domino row of unexpected incidents.

group_1.textLeft: So if I'd never become a Diviner, Charu wouldn't @have had to bear any of this...
Dooon't even start!
We already decided to stick together. No hand-wringing!

group_1.textRight: O—okay. Got it.

group_1.textLeft: So, how are the other villagers doing? @They all seem to have been on edge for a while...

group_1.textRight: In the end, this village owes its existence to the Diviners' blessing, too.
They've had it easy living here, only ever having to @grow crops for themselves.
In short, now that their financial support is gone, @all the adults are up to their necks with worry.
I'm no exception, of course.

group_1.textLeft: Please don't say that so casually...

group_1.textRight: The funds needed to maintain the village could be @part of why Mikoshiba was panicked.
It's a very likely possibility.

group_1.textLeft: ...Just as we're worrying about our futures @as Diviners...
I suppose everyone in the village will have a lot @to worry about from now on, too.

group_1.textRight: That's true.

group_1.textLeft: Did you happen to find anything else?

group_1.textRight: Hmm. If you mean something interesting, @there was a Tokime family tree, at least?
It seems like our bloodline has actually spread out all around the country.
There's blood relatives of ours living up on other mountains, for instance, and even seaside areas!

group_1.textLeft: Woah—.

group_1.textRight: So, what are you three going to do, Charu? @That's my biggest question.

group_1.textLeft: We have a clear answer in our minds.
We know what we'll fight for in our hearts, @and what we want to accomplish in life!

group_1.textRight: My, how very reliable.
Then what's your first step?

group_1.textLeft: First, we'll have a conversation with Lord Kyūbē!

group_1.textRight: With Lord Kyūbē?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. We imagine he might have some information...
about a method by which we can avoid becoming Devils.
From there, we'll plan our future according @to what we learn.

group_1.textRight: At the very least, I imagine the three of you are @sticking together?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah!
Because we've got to change the fate of us Diviners!
